title: Lambda function with % chance of throwing an error
description: The function throws an error based on a % chance provided by an environment variable.

introBox.headline: How it works
text: This snippet creates a Lambda function in Node.js that has a percentage chance of throwing an error. The code uses a Lambda environment variable called CHANCE_OF_FAILURE, which is a value between 0 and 100. If this environment variable is not present, it defaults to 50 (a 50% chance of throwing an error).
This function can be useful for testing failure modes and retry behaviors when consuming events from upstream services.
